reviews.text: Quiet, clean and safe. Close to the Medina and easy to find.
reviews.title: Best value for money
Clean and nice

reviews.text: Problem: by phone the staff don´t give enough information. No tranfer from the airport, even under request.
reviews.title: Good Located

reviews.text: Close to the Medina and the port.
reviews.title: Posh Digs in the Heart of Casablanca

reviews.text: The hotel is nice, breakfast very good.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel in Downtown Casablanca

reviews.text: Excellent hotel in many ways, specially taking into account what you pay for it. In almost all aspects, it's a 5*hotel: spa, swimming-pool, parking, jazz bar, piano bar, excellent breakfast, excellent room, excellent bed, clean toilet, calm, decent room service,internet... Drawbacks? It's noisy as hell though its double screen windows due to its location in the heart of a busy rond-point of the city. Internet was not running very efficiently and there's only 2 pc's downstairs. As for the staff, well, this is Morocco? It all looks really good but when you scracth a little, there's nothing behind. Same old stories instead of sharp YES or NO. The computer room technician left "faire des affaires" and we were told he was due back in 20minutes. 2 hours later he still wasn't back. After some thorough investigation, no one had a clue where he was or had been. Thus, it was a useless typical getaway lie to say he was due back in 20 minutes. He wasn't due back. that was the right answer in teh first place. These things can get on your nerves in the long run, but it still doesn't change the fact that it's a very good option for CASABLANCA having tried others.
reviews.title: Excellent quality/price rate though still a long way to go.
Total inability of the staff to communicate
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for a business trip and it was truly one of the worst hotel experiences I have had. The hotel booking voucher said that the airport transfer was included, it wasn't and I had to draw local currency to pay the driver. They brought me the wrong room service order, I had to ask twice for them to bring me what I had actually ordered. Also had problems connecting to the internet, which is essential for me during business travel. The staff were surly and didn't even bother to listen to what I was saying half the time. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone. The only reason I didn't rate it as "terrible" is that the rooms are clean and generally well-equipped.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Golden Tulip Farah as part of a 4 day visit to Morocco arrived quite late but the desk staff were very friendly and made sure i had everything i needed. The room was large and the bed very comfortable Plenty of space for clothing etc and at no point did the room feel cr amped.
reviews.title: First class hotel, great location, and fantastic staff

reviews.text: Used 3 of the restaurants at the hotel and on each occasion the food was fantastic and the service first calss.
reviews.title: Excellent location, great service, good amenities

reviews.text: Used the gym good modern equipment only downside the Turkish baths were closed.
reviews.title: Nice hotel , Great people

reviews.text: If you have spent some days at a beautiful Riad in another Moroccan town than Casablanca, this hotel comes as quite a shock to you, with its very small rooms and rather poor amenities. However I have made the experience that everything works, from a nice welcome at the reception to fast lifts and a very generous breakfast buffet. I mentioned that my TV did not work and somebody came up and fixed it within minutes. There is also a beautiful entrance hall with lots of space where you can sit or meet, the rooms are clean and the beds are good, the hot water comes instantaneously etc. So what if the view out of the hotel window on a very dreary Casablanca (even in the sun) is not very inspiring, give the hotel the credit that it deserves. For lack of having heard of any great hotel in Casablanca, I shall return to this one next year.
reviews.title: Give credit where it is due

reviews.text: I have stayed here many times and last reviewed the hotel in 2010. I have been here for a week now on business, and wanted to update my last review. I still find the hotel quite nice for the price paid. I have learned that most of the time in Morocco (and I have lived here now for eight years) you need to deduct a star from what is advertised.
reviews.title: Continued great place to stay in Casablanca for the price
This is not really a 5* hotel
reviews.text: This hotel is clean and well located. It has good service, underground parking, and a nice indoor pool on the third floor. Room service is, as in all the hotels in Morocco, over priced. The menu here is limited and the food is adequate at best. I would comment that the breakfast chef cooks his eggs better than any other hotel in Morocco (and believe me I have had eggs in most of them). They are always cooked exactly as ordered and not overcooked and brown as is often the case in Morocco.

The room is well lit and comfortable. The bed a little hard and the pillows barely acceptable (unless you like them also hard). The small flat screen TV is mounted on the wall and is about the minimum size you would want in a hotel.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel close to Souq

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Maid service is good and the room was always well cleaned. A small tip to the maid is always appreciated.
reviews.title: Very nice 5* hotel for the price

reviews.text: The Golden Tulip Farah Hotel in Casablanca is a magnificent hotel with mostly outstanding and helpful staff...However beware the sting in the tail....
reviews.title: Bitter sweet rip off
Nice hotel, although looks prettier in pictures than in real life

reviews.text: The morning of my departure was an enlightening moment in time, having paid for my accomoadion ahead of time with a recognsed Hotel broker (as most of us do). I was dumbfounded to be told by the male front desk person, that they had no record of my account being paid.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: This despite having resided in the hotel for two days, as well as me having given them printouts of the receipt of payment, which unfortunate for them, and fortunatelly for me, I remembered which drawer the previous front desk person had placed these articles in.
reviews.title: Stay way clear of this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Eventually, and after quite an unpleasant confrontation with aforementioned male front desk person, I was able to compel the manager to come out of his office and despite great reluctance, force him to open the specific drawer I remembered the receipts being placed in, where Voila to their great surprise, what do we have here, oh my god the reseipts.....you have paid your account !!!! Surprise! Surprise! Surprise!
reviews.title: Perfectly fine, but not much flair
